abstract: update : woman left brain-dead by west boynton crash id 'd , pbso says .
article: 8 a. m. update : investigators have learned the identity of the woman and were reaching out to her next of kin late wednesday , the palm beach county sheriff 's office said . the office did not immediately release the woman 's name . original post : the palm beach county sheriff 's office needs the public 's help in identifying a woman who is brain-dead and on life support at delray medical center after she was struck by a vehicle sunday in indian spring country club in suburban boynton beach . the woman is described as being between 40 and 60 years old with brown hair and brown eyes .

she is around 5 feet 3 inches and 145 pounds and was wearing a baseball cap , gray sweat pants , a black t-shirt with a colorful design by christian audigier , a red fila sweater , a tan jacket and bright pink nike sneakers , according to pbso . the woman has at least one denture plate and was wearing two rings . investigators were unable to locate any missing person at the time of the crash that fits the woman 's description . the woman does not appear homeless , according to pbso . the crash took place on el clair ranch road , north of green golf lane , at about 6 a. m.frank schwartz jr. .
of margate was driving a 2013 nissan that struck the woman . schwartz remained at the scene and called 911 .
